summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, providing the password for a disc containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being transmitted.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery materials.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a password for a disc containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell's case to the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for a disc containing discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell, who is identified by her Bureau of Prisons register number (02879-509).
The letter indicates ongoing legal proceedings and evidence sharing in Maxwell's case as of April 2021.
Audrey Strauss was the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
The document confirms Maxwell was held at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.
